title: How to Get a Parrot Off Your Shoulder in Minecraft

steps.title: Jump down from a high level or otherwise lose elevation.
steps.content: Jump down from a high level or otherwise lose elevation. Hopping down from a higher surface typically gets a parrot to fly off your shoulder, as well as: [1] X Research source Heading down a hill Flying to a lower elevation (with an Elytra equipped) Setting off a firework rocket

steps.title: Go to bed.
steps.content: Go to bed. Some Minecraft enthusiasts find that crafting and climbing into a bed makes a parrot hop off the player’s shoulder.

steps.title: Swim for a little while.
steps.content: Swim for a little while. Head to a nearby body of water (like a river or ocean) and swim—the parrot should leave your shoulder once you jump in.

steps.title: Take damage or get killed.
steps.content: Take damage or get killed. While this method isn’t ideal, getting attacked by hostile mobs or dying can get a parrot off your shoulder.

steps.title: Command your parrot to sit to keep it from getting back on your shoulder.
steps.content: Command your parrot to sit to keep it from getting back on your shoulder. Sitting parrots stay stationary and won’t fly back over to you: PC/Mac: Right-click Xbox: LT PlayStation: L2 Nintendo Switch: ZL Mobile: Tap Sit

steps.title: Feed the parrot any type of wild seed.
steps.content: Feed the parrot any type of wild seed. Hold some wheat seeds in your hand and right-click (PC/Mac) on the parrot (or use the corresponding console control). Continue feeding the parrot until red hearts appear around it—that’s how you know you’ve tamed it . [2] X Research source All types of seeds work for this, including melon seeds , pumpkin seeds, beetroot seeds, and even cocoa beans.

steps.title: Walk directly through the parrot.
steps.content: Walk directly through the parrot. Crossing the parrot’s path causes it to fly over and perch on your shoulder.

steps.title: Collect up to 2 parrots on your shoulders.
steps.content: Collect up to 2 parrots on your shoulders. Repeat this process with multiple parrots to get 2 parrots perching on your shoulders.
